DataElement.preferredName: Adult Comorbidity Evaluation-27 26 Obesity Severity Assessment Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Assessment of the severity of comorbidity associated with obesity, using a 3 grade scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adult Comorbidity Evaluation-27 Obesity Severity Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 27-item comorbidity index for patients with cancer. ACE27 includes comorbid conditions of various organ systems, as well as malignancy, substance abuse, and body weight._Having a high amount of body fat (body mass index [BMI] of 30 or more)._Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 27-item comorbidity index for patients with cancer. ACE27 includes comorbid conditions of various organ systems, as well as malignancy, substance abuse, and body weight.

Concepts.definition: A 27-item comorbidity index for patients with cancer. ACE27 includes comorbid conditions of various organ systems, as well as malignancy, substance abuse, and body weight.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having a high amount of body fat (body mass index [BMI] of 30 or more).:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Having a high amount of body fat (body mass index [BMI] of 30 or more).
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Decomposition Grade 1 through 3 ranging from Grade 1: Mild Decompensation through Grade 3: Severe Decompensation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gentle or temperate in nature or degree.: The inability of an organ or organ system to maintain homeostasis due to functional overload, often caused by the presence of disease intrinsic to the organ or organ system, or dysfunction in other organ systems.

Concepts.definition: Gentle or temperate in nature or degree.

The inability of an organ or organ system to maintain homeostasis due to functional overload, often caused by the presence of disease intrinsic to the organ or organ system, or dysfunction in other organ systems.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.: The inability of an organ or organ system to maintain homeostasis due to functional overload, often caused by the presence of disease intrinsic to the organ or organ system, or dysfunction in other organ systems.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

The inability of an organ or organ system to maintain homeostasis due to functional overload, often caused by the presence of disease intrinsic to the organ or organ system, or dysfunction in other organ systems.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.: The inability of an organ or organ system to maintain homeostasis due to functional overload, often caused by the presence of disease intrinsic to the organ or organ system, or dysfunction in other organ systems.

Concepts.definition: Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

The inability of an organ or organ system to maintain homeostasis due to functional overload, often caused by the presence of disease intrinsic to the organ or organ system, or dysfunction in other organ systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The inability of an organ or organ system to maintain homeostasis due to functional overload, often caused by the presence of disease intrinsic to the organ or organ system, or dysfunction in other organ systems.:A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
